revised_title: On the Elasticity of Crystals and Boscovich's Theory
tldr: The author investigates the elasticity of crystals using Boscovich's mathematical theory. They explore the forces between crystalline molecules and demonstrate how different laws of variation can be assigned to give various properties to the solid. The study focuses on the simplest Boscovichian idea of a crystal, a homogeneous group of single points, and how it relates to the incompressibility of the solid.
